intro: Stigmatodactylus celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes stigmatodactyl, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, which are followed by bright red berries. It is often found in tropical rainforests, growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
